sentence.Network_en: People celebrating the armistice behaved like an orgiastic mob.
sentence.Network_cn: 庆祝停战的人们象一群狂欢的暴民.

sentence.Network_en: Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgiastic future that year by year recedes before us.
sentence.Network_cn: 盖茨比信奉这盏绿灯, 这个一年年在我们眼前渐渐远去的极乐的未来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from Greek orgiastikos, from orgiastēs, agent noun from orgiazein 'hold an orgy'

entry.def: An orgiastic event is one in which people enjoy themselves in an extreme, uncontrolled way.

auth_sentence.content: Machine-gun drum stutters herald an orgiastic overlapping of howling and sustained climaxing.
